dspace-development.title: E-Persons should be encoded with UTF-8

comments.body:
The submitter who prompted this issue was still seeing his name displayed incorrectly in the system as of 2021-02-03 at 5:30 pm:
![Character encoding error](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/66128387/106896639-d8fa4880-66bf-11eb-8f80-a5ff996c7ec2.jpg)
I saw a difference on my side of things, where Bo's name was listed in my pool: it looked corrected just after 4:00 PM on 2021-02-04
At approximately 10am today, I fixed Bo's name. I expect that, were he to log in again, Shibboleth would overwrite. I intend to elevate this issue to Atmire.

lux.title: LibraryHeader main menu button needs aria-label
Fixes accessibility issue of missing aria-label in LibraryHeader

comments.body:
## dump_types
### label: 'Changed Records'
  constant: 'CHANGED_RECORDS'
Bib records from incremental dump. This dump depends on the merged_ids in order to work.

### label: 'All Bib IDs'
  constant: 'BIB_IDS'
There are none of these currently in bibdata events. This is just a list of bib ids. Can't find evidence of use in the code.

### label: 'All Bib IDs with Holdings'
  constant: 'MERGED_IDS'
Rake task finds all bib IDS and merges in the holdings. This is used to figure out which bibs we need for the changed records dump. See reference to `earlier_merged_dump` in `Dump#diff_since-last`

### label: 'All Records'
  constant: 'ALL_RECORDS'
All bibs in a full dump

### label: 'Updated Princeton ReCAP Records'
  constant: 'PRINCETON_RECAP'
  cron: https://github.com/pulibrary/marc_liberation/blob/cd7226c1e3b97a630c5e334dc1004916e985d0ef/config/schedule.rb#L75
These are created to be sent to SCSB. We do not load these files locally with traject.
These are currently broken and fixing them has been on hold.

### label: 'Updated Partner ReCAP Records'
  constant: 'PARTNER_RECAP'
We pull the latest updates from the partners (columbia, nypl). Then we run these through traject to index into our catalog.
https://github.com/pulibrary/marc_liberation/blob/cd7226c1e3b97a630c5e334dc1004916e985d0ef/config/schedule.rb#L80 

## dump_file_types
### label: 'Updated Records'
  constant: 'UPDATED_RECORDS'
### label: 'New Records'
  constant: 'NEW_RECORDS'
Not used

### label: 'All Bib IDs with Holdings'
  constant: 'MERGED_IDS'
### label: 'All Bib IDs'
  constant: 'BIB_IDS'
### label: 'All Bib Records'
  constant: 'BIB_RECORDS'
### label: 'Updated ReCAP Records'
  constant: 'RECAP_RECORDS'
### label: 'Log File'
  constant: 'LOG_FILE'
The partner_recap dump will have a log file along with the file of records

Coverage increased (+0.02%) to 82.508% when pulling **061dbf76615888f804c6cee7ec959748b7f3c4fd on 1032-barcode-not-found** into **682b98acbb44bffa95c6e7b61e92c57cdfebb251 on alma**.

marc_liberation.title: Some records erroring on scsb endpoint
Ensure we encode alma responses as utf-8

comments.body:
[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/36877175/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/36877175)

Coverage increased (+0.2%) to 82.732% when pulling **d22ab4e8734897db993348a8e2cee26755ff0d0d on 1041-encoding** into **3dbf16aa732c17653ee92ce6b1a51ce58dc154af on alma**.

@hectorcorrea thanks! after giving this another look I realized I was putting my test in the wrong place; I needed it in the controller to trigger the error because that's where it converts to the xml string. This now has a test and is ready to review if you please.

I am having a hard time getting the error to be logged again and the I noticed that the [offending Solr config values](https://github.com/pulibrary/pul_solr/blob/main/solr_configs/catalog-staging/conf/solrconfig.xml#L156-L162) are section 

```
<listener event="newSearcher" class="solr.QuerySenderListener">
```

What or who uses this listener?
I think newsearcher is fired whenever solr starts a new searcher object. So you would put things here to warm caches that you expect to be used, like common facets or common search queries.

comments.body: To resume the princeton updates https://github.com/pulibrary/marc_liberation/blob/cd7226c1e3b97a630c5e334dc1004916e985d0ef/config/schedule.rb#L75 we still need to fix https://github.com/pulibrary/voyager_helpers/issues/120#issue-718133894.

From conversation with Mark: deadlines here have shifted, but they're deploying their new code in March so presumably we won't be able to retrieve the files in their current location anymore at that point.

There is a meeting on Monday that will discuss the release cycle for the
next SCSB deployment to production, we should know the planned date then.

On Thu, Feb 4, 2021 at 3:47 PM hackartisan <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> retrieve the files in their current location anymore at that point.

pulfalight.title: Adds contextual h1 to collection search results
Add full reindex rake task.
Fix case sensitive environment typo in full reindex.
Periodic test failure
Keyword search for name in direct order yields too many results

comments.body: @faithc Is this still the case? I can set the required matches to be higher, but I'm concerned it'll filter out matches folks might want to find (in this case, for instance, data's in there as both Vinton, Frederick and Vinton, Frederic, with various dates depending on when the correspondence was.)

I think there are still too many results, and that it should mimic the behavior of pulfa 2 where one gets only 4 results regardless of how one enters the name. The other results that are displaying in pulfalight have nothing to do with Frederick Vinton. https://findingaids.princeton.edu/?v1=Vinton%2C+Frederick++&f1=kw&b1=AND&v2=&f2=kw&b2=AND&v3=&f3=kw&year=before&ed=&ld=&rpp=10&start=0 vs. https://findingaids-beta.princeton.edu/?utf8=%E2%9C%93&group=true&search_field=all_fields&q=Vinton%2C+Frederick.
@faithc Even https://findingaids-beta.princeton.edu/catalog/C0344 ? (Fourth result down on Pulfalight)

There's a good chance https://findingaids-beta.princeton.edu/catalog/TC011_c194 is a match too, which wouldn't match if Frederick had to be included. How about I set the minimum must match on staging after it indexes everything and we can see how it looks?

That's "Rand, Vinton" and "Rand, Wakefield" though. 

Guess we could try that, but I still think whatever method is being used on the current site seems appropriate.
The indexing backends are different, so I'm not sure we'll hit precisely the same results coming back, but I can definitely make it stricter so we can see how it goes.

(Sorry for the back and forth, by the way, I've personally always preferred too-many-results with the relevant ones popping up at the top, rather than fewer results where I worry I miss things - too much google I guess. 😅 )
Ha, that's ok. It's good to think through, but I definitely think stricter matching is the way to go for this site. Just wanna loop @ccleeton in too.
